str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.
Strong (originally and generally of physical strength); mighty, powerful, vehement, sure. From ischus; forcible.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To arm completely. From kata; and hoplizo; to equip fully with armor.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: From the same as aer; a yard; by implication, a mansion.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
